events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car that occurred on a busy intersection early in the morning.
The claim was reviewed and categorized as an Auto Accident based on provided details and keywords like vehicle and collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with claim processing and next steps.
The customer was contacted and the claim was acknowledged, confirming receipt of all initial information.
Requested additional proof of damage, photos of the vehicle, police report, and repair estimates from the customer.
Customer submitted the requested documents including photos of the damaged car and the official police accident report.
Investigation into the accident circumstances started to verify facts and assess liability for the collision.
Investigation completed confirming the accident details matched customer statements and police report findings.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repairs and related expenses as per policy.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and appreciated the clarity provided throughout the process.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company following customer acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment for the vehicle repair costs was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account as part of the approved claim.
The claim was officially closed after payment issuance and confirmation that the customer was satisfied with outcome.
The case files and documentation were archived per company policy for future reference in case of disputes.
